Add-ons

Posted January 28th, 2014 by Article Author.

The following add-ons are for demonstration purposes only. You may have other add-ons that you prefer. Please use those if you're more comfortable with them. Hopefully this list will get you thinking about the full array of add-ons that could be used on a typical responsive site.

Modal Dialog

Here's a simple modal dialog. It can contain text content (initially hidden on page load) or some other type of content such as a single image, a responsive video, or a gallery of images:

Sample Modal Dialog

Collapsible Content

The following sections of content toggle opened and closed. The main purpose is to save vertical space on tall pages. Each section is collapsed by default.

Collapsible Section

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus magna. Cras in mi at felis aliquet congue. Ut a est eget ligula molestie gravida. Curabitur massa. Donec eleifend, libero at sagittis mollis, tellus est malesuada tellus, at luctus turpis elit sit amet quam.

Show Less ^

Drag-and-Drop Lists

Drag-and-drop items to re-order them. Add a group option in the JavaScript activation to combine the lists so that they can be dragged from one list into the other. Refer to the Nestable GitHub repo for advanced configuration options.

Full Width Selection

This list allows the user to select the full width of the item. Items can be dragged from one list into the other. They can also be indented by dragging slightly to the right. Lists can be expanded/collapsed by selecting the minus/plus.

  1. Item 1
  2. Item 2
  3. Item 3
  4. Item 4
  5. Item 5
  1. Item 6
  2. Item 7
  3. Item 8
  4. Item 9
  5. Item 10

Serialized Output (right):

Draggable Handles

This list allows the user to select a handle on the left side of the item.

    Item 1

    Item 2

    Item 3
